reasons_to_visit.details: Candlelit restaurants, boutique hotels, and skyline views make Edinburgh ideal for Valentine's getaways.
Events like Candlemas concerts and light trails brighten winter evenings.
Nearby gardens open special paths to carpets of white blooms.
Interactive science shows and storytelling sessions keep families engaged.

reasons_to_reconsider.details: Rain, sleet, and sunshine can appear within the same hour-flexible plans are essential.
Evenings remain dark, so plan outdoor adventures before 5pm.
Valentine's dining and family workshops require advance reservations.

weather.precipitation: Persistent drizzle with occasional clear, crisp mornings.
weather.general_tips: Waterproof outer layers plus scarves and gloves keep you comfortable on walking tours.

tourism_level.crowds: Low to moderate, with slight bump on Valentine's weekend.
tourism_level.pricing: Hotels offer romance packages; restaurants increase set menus.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Soft lighting and quieter streets create an intimate city feel.

events_holidays.name: Valentine's Weekend
events_holidays.description: Hotels and restaurants craft special menus, while the castle offers sunset proposals.
events_holidays.notes: Reserve tables at least two weeks ahead; request window seats for skyline views.

unique_experiences.activity: Private tour of the Royal Yacht Britannia
unique_experiences.description: Discover royal stories with a glass of fizz on the veranda deck.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Book the audio-guided private opening for quieter exploration.

unique_experiences.description: Capture romantic cobbled backdrops with a local photographer.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Schedule around golden hour for soft light; carry umbrellas for drizzle.

unique_experiences.description: Blankets of snowdrops frame old estate ruins just outside the city.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Take bus 41 to Cammo Road then follow signposted woodland paths.

unique_experiences.description: Craft your own botanical blend guided by distillers in atmospheric vaults.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Classes sell out in winter-book three weeks in advance.

weather.precipitation: Showers lighten toward month's end; winds strengthen along the coast.
weather.general_tips: Carry a compact umbrella and plan indoor cultural stops for rainy spells.

tourism_level.crowds: Moderate during Scottish half-term; attractions add extra family sessions.
tourism_level.pricing: Family bundles and off-peak hotel rates available midweek.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Lively with schoolchildren exploring science festivals and museums.

events_holidays.name: Mid-term Break
events_holidays.description: Schools close for a week, increasing demand for indoor attractions.
events_holidays.notes: Pre-book camera obscura and Dynamic Earth sessions.

unique_experiences.description: Sneak peeks of upcoming exhibits with hands-on experiments.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check the programme for free drop-in workshops.

unique_experiences.description: Discover new Scottish writing in an intimate auditorium.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Buy standby tickets for discounts; arrive early for bar chatter.

unique_experiences.activity: Coastal day trip to North Berwick
unique_experiences.description: Climb the Law for views or visit the Scottish Seabird Centre to spot early gannets.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Take the 33-minute train from Waverley; pack windbreakers for cliff walks.

unique_experiences.description: Join locals for traditional dancing led by live bands.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Wear comfortable shoes and layers; no experience required.
